page.title: 04Farming near Burscough
page.content: The major land use in this area is agricultural grade one. Much of the land is moss land and was submerged beneath Martin Mere at one time one of the largest lakes in Lancashire.Over the last three hundred years schemes to drain the lake have led to the situation today with several miles of near flat fields seperated by drainage ditches growing crops such as peas,potatoes and carrots. The moss soils are organic,fertile soils with patches of sand and clay making them ideal for arable farming. The land is easy to work.The soil tends to be very wet and good drainage is essential.Local climate is mild and there are few frosts.Flooding on low lying moss land has been a problem but since 1961 a drainage scheme linked to the Ribble estuary has improved this.
